Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Tony M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days. Both beds I slept in had bed bugs. My upper body looked nasty. I had bites all up my arms and my chest area including one Huge bite on my nipple. The staff was rude and not helping me out. The hotel believes they dont have bed bugs and it was something I ate. The manager was unhelpful. No refund or even food vouchers. Do not Stay in room 530.. BED bugs. This hotel should have a Zero rating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: gina2384
Reviews.Content: We booked Tryp Diana for a cheap sun holiday knowing it was far from centre of madrid but with transport links, close to the airport with the added bonus of a pool. With a quick phone call to the hotel to annouce your arrival they notify you that the shuttle will be on its way to meet you from the bus stop. This can be quite confusing but simply head towards number 1 and you will see a sign for hotel buses and the minibuses that arrive have the hotel name on so you can't go wrong. The bus is air conditioned and will go to other terminals to pick up other passengers. The day before you leave you need to tell the reception what time you need to leave and the minibus is arranged to take you back. Saves you a lot of Euros so a great bonus. The reception staff are very helpful and speak english. If you want to use the wifi you must collect daily a sheet of paper with the login details. We had good connection in our rooms but not by the pool. The pool is open 1pm- 8pm this can be annoying but we found it adequate. There are parts which are in shade due to the large trees but this is often welcomed in the 40degree celsius heat! The only problem was that there are only 9 sunbed two of which are broken but still useable so if you are a sun worshipper you need to be there at 1pm however people come and go from the pool so you might get lucky. The hotel has towels available at the pool so you dont need to bring your own. There isnt a bar by the pool but they dont mind you eating and drinking. We didn't choose the buffet options for eating as they were pretty dear. about 10euro for breakfast and 17euro for lunch/dinner. We went to the local supermarket which is a 3-5min walk and bought croissants, jam and salami's for breakfast and made sandwiches for lunch. There are bars and other places to eat in the hotel which are nice and restaurants within walking distance mainly italien and burger places but resonably priced. The rooms are of a good decor and high standard. Cleaned everyday so if you are staying more than one night remember your do not disturb sign so you don't get woken by the maid. The ensuite in the room was clean and always had hot water. All rooms have balconies and there are twin and double rooms. There is air con which is defo needed in the heat. Only negative was found the bed rock hard/firm which was a struggle when you are staying for 8 nights and there is no fridge which would be nice for water. There was some building work going on which they advied through posters near the lifts, so heard hammering from about 9am which was a little annoying for those who want to lie in. To get to central madrid you can walk to Alameda de Osuna metro station to get the line 5 metro. This takes you to all the best places. I suggest getting off at callao as gran via, sol, opera are all within walking distance. I suggest buying the 10 journey ticket its 12 euro but can be used for more than 1 person as it simply deducts the journey so you can pass the ticket back to whoever you are travelling with. I would defo recommend this hotel and would return again for a city break to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Right hotel for the right reason”
Reviews.Author: PlayballTim
Reviews.Content: Better-than-average hotel <2miles from the airport, but ~a half hour from the heart of the city, so you know that it's a very good overnight hotel for the airport. (But with a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro (line 5 - Almeda Osuna), you can still get downtown directly.) The area around the hotel is full of residential high-rises, so not a lot going on, but inside the hotel there are 4 or 5 good dining options that are mostly there for the locals. I especially liked the 2 pubs on the first floor, which both have outdoor seating. The rooms were large and quiet, and I think most every room has a balcony patio, which I really enjoyed. I found the hallways to be a bit dark and creepy, though. Two small knocks are the pool hours (1pm-8pm), which I wish were more lengthy, and the bed, which was very firm. All in all, though, a good hotel and good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice staff very rude!”
Reviews.Author: Ozgens
Reviews.Content: We staid at this hotel it was ok however the staff were not very helpful at all the ladies at the reception were good however the men were arrogant and rude didnt want to help at all, if i go to madrid again will not stay at this hotel also pool opens from 1pm to 8pm so clearly did not have a chance to use this as it was right in the middle of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: ney_spark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tryp Diana Madrid for one night for transit. The room is spacios, has a large bathroom, w all amenities. PROS: location near the airport, price, free non-stop transfer to/from airport, room size Nu CONS, just a comment: when arriving, we were offered a room w broken toilet seat. We asked reception for change of room, that was done easily and swift and the 2nd room was nicer - furniture looked newer, the windows opened properly. We did not have time to use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: GuyWikeley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights July/Aug 2012. This hotel is well positioned for the airport but is equally as well positioned for trips into Madrid city centre. The tube station is a five minute walk and it's Two Euros (each way), taking about half an hour to Opera station. The hotel is clean, is a four star hotel and has a good many places to eat both inside the hotel and in the surrounding area. Air conditioned, flat screen TV, Good modern bathroom and decent sized room. Staff were efficient. There are two small "squares" closeby (just before the tube) where meals can be taken (including breakfast). This hotel was very reasonably priced. The car parking is tight in the area and we used the hotel car park, which at 18 Euros a night was peace of mind as the car was loaded up. They have limited car parking space underground. All in all, I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again and recommend it. This hotel was very reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for overnight stay, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Genk91
Reviews.Content: I was based in Madrid for work for one week so chose to stay at the Tryp Diana as it is very close to the airport. The room is very basic, with no fridge which was far from ideal in my eyes, along with a safe which you must enter 1euro every time you wish to open and close it! To the hotels credit, the shuttle bus is very good, simply book the night before which slot you wish to depart (every 30mins) and the bus turns up at the exact time. Even if you arrive very late at night, simply give the hotel a call and they will pick you up within 15minutes. Breakfast at the Tryp Diana was good, nice variety of produce varying from freshly cooked eggs, bacon & sausages, to cold meats, rolls, fruit and cereals. The swimming pool is ok however there is a severe shortage of sun loungers, only about ten available. The main downside for me was the price of food at the hotel and not having a fridge in the room, as a result I moved on after a couple of nights here.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER”
Reviews.Author: Rui J
Reviews.Content: When I go to the hotel, according to the staff I didn't make any reservations... I asked them to double check the answer was the same. I had to pay for the internet in order to forward my booking confirmation to their e-mail. The staff was rude. After using the internet, the reception's man, admited that he was wrong and showed me that in fact I had a reservation made. Went for dinner, only two tables were being served (mine and another one), still the staff was EXTREMELY SLOW. The next day I went to have breakfast, the staff was again very rude. The airport shuffle was 30 minutes late.... To make things "better" : THEY CAN'T SPEAK ENGLISH.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a comfortable overnight close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: francophilesSpain
Reviews.Content: Quiet location,comfortable room and, a good choice of eating places and bars within the hotel. The free airport shuttle is a big advantage. No worries about getting on it, either, as you need to reserve in advance at reception. Polite, efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money, close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent value for money. Plentiful seating areas, spacious and clean. Shops and Tapas bar inside the hotel, very convenient. Nice pool area. Free airport shuttle. Cons: Pool are did not open until 1pm. This is really absurd! Why have a nice pool and sun loungers if one can cannot use them first thing in the morning through to evening?

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Monica_VX
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here four times in the last fifteen years and have always been happy with my visits. The hotel has been here for a while but the rooms are clean and modern. The shutlle is reliable and quick (considering the sprawling layout of the airport). If able it would be wise to book ahead if you plan to stay. Luckily we did and then the Iberia pilots went on strike. The lobby was full of angry, sweaty passengers but we just picked up our keys and went to our room. Beware if you visit by car, the hotel is next to impossible to find and parking is a nightmare. There is a metro stop nearby that seems to be walkable but I haven't done it yet. When I come back to Madrid I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay before flight”
Reviews.Author: DmitryP4
Reviews.Content: Nice and very convenient place to stay before your flight in Madrid. Nice free of charge internet. Excellent free of charge shuttle to Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mauncg
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel about 6 or 7 years ago and were quite pleased with the location and quick shuttle back and forth to the airport, so we thought we'd try it again. Check-in was quick and we like the fact that there are a variety of bars and cafes in the same hotel complex. The best surprise was the "sushi to go" place and we got an order to take up to our room for dinner. The rooms do have that early 70s look, but ours was spotless with a cozy bed and a roll away for our 8 year old. Another nice feature was the small public park behind the hotel which included a playground that our 2.5 yr old loved. There is also a basketball court, but you'd have to bring your own ball. The bathroom was immaculate with all modern features. We also enjoyed sitting out on the balcony of our room, although there was no light switch to be found for the overhead light fixture. The only disappointment was that the pool was closed for another month and we found this was odd with the high temperatures that have already hit Madrid in June.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeding expectations”
Reviews.Author: jjthebig1
Reviews.Content: I booked a room there for a long layover and was surprised, in a good way, at the quality and value of this hotel. The lobby is super nice, the rooms all have balconies, bathroom has marble tiles up to the roof, 5 restaurants, free wifi and airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist trap”
Reviews.Author: athletico
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a long weekend, in hindsight it would have been cheaper to stay in central Madrid. Free wifi but public internet is 1 € for 7 min, the swimming pool was closed and everything costs an arm and a leg. surly staff and poor location i thought the rooms were ok clean. it would be ok for one night but any more than that you would need therapy to get over the cost and negativity

Reviews.Title: “Only for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: invocator
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be really good when you entered it since its new on the reception but the rooms are really old.

Reviews.Title: “Bad receptionist and park area”
Reviews.Author: terrano_tr
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend this hotel to anybody. Their politic is only how to earn money. They do not care about customer's problem and their solution. inexperinced receptionist and the do not know to speak english. Do not believe and count on them for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, choose somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: p750777
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel, it needs serious refurbishment. The rooms are ancient, not soundproofed and beds are awful. Also be very careful with your belongings in the lobby, one of our group had a rucksack stolen and CCTV showed an older guy stealing it... This is apparently not unusual... You have been warned

Reviews.Title: “This is not 4 star in any !!”
Reviews.Author: Whyland1
Reviews.Content: Chech in took 1/2 hour for no good reason. Room key did not work. Bed was twin not double as booked. Noisy due to adjacent park and delivery trucks all night. Rooms were clean but beds on steel legs w no box spring. Manager was a real knucklehead. Avoid this hotel like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “miserable”
Reviews.Author: jaemunki
Reviews.Content: Clearly an old hotel that has been bought out by a large hotel franchise. And yes we found our way here due to it being an Iberia "dumping ground". After Iberia stopped flying to our home town, (no one bothered to notify us of this) we were put up here. The rooms are old and decrepit, the beds uncomfortable and despite the bathrooms having been recently renovated the bath was stained as was the toilet. Dinner was miserable with the worst service and equally miserable, not to mention rude, staff. The starter was a full plate of spaghetti bolognaise - that was actually spaghetti in tomato sauce. The mains was two big cold thin pieces of steak-flavoured bubblegum, that were a work out to cut with the butter knifes. The location in relation to the airport is good - if it wasn't for their deal with Iberia (or, for that matter, a functioning airline) I doubt they would get any business. Definitely won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is no four star hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: Edward_Fo
Reviews.Content: After waiting for 50 minutes for the complimentary shuttle (not to mention having to call twice for the service) and the journey only taking less than ten minutes we arrived at the hotel. Do not be deceived this is not a four star hotel but at the lower end of a three star graded hotel. The hotel is also going through renovation and like others who have mentioned it before needs to employ more reception staff. It took 20 minutes before we we were assigned a room on the fifth floor. The same floor which was being renovated and forget taking an alarm clock as the workmen will wake you up with their activities at 08:30. The rooms are basic with no safe but do have wooden floors, which have the ability to echo all the movements of the occupiers. The walls are thin and the free wi-fi offer is not true as you only get 50 minutes max. If you dare use the PCs in the lobby area please be aware that they cost 1 euro for 7.5 minutes. The first 2 minutes is taken up loading the home page. The breakfast buffet closes at 10:30 and costs nine Euros per person. The hotel is very close to the metro - line no 5 (green line) and takes 20 minutes into central town. Would I recommend the hotel - only if you want to risk be bitten by bed bugs and the exclusive view of residential homes all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel prior to catching a flight to Miami the next day. The room was ok but the floors were "wood" and every sound from the rooms above were amplified in our room, we got very little sleep. We went to the lobby cafe for breakfast (which we discovered later was not owned by the hotel), my wife went to order coffee and croissants while I paid the 80€ room bill. I joined my wife and sat with her, after 5 minutes we went to leave, only to discover her handbag had been stolen. We are seasoned travellers and well aware of the many "pickpockets" that tour around Europe, but the window of opportunity to steal this bag was estimated at 15 seconds. We lost passports credit cards and cash. We raced to reception to report it and call the police, the reception staff treated it like it was an everyday occurance and showed no concern whatsoever. The HotelManager was in the coffee shop at the same time and came to my wifes aid, he called the police and helped us get a taxi to the British Consulate. We had to cancel our flight to Miami, our cruise, in fact the whole holiday. It was a nightmare. We found out that the coffee shop had no CCTV and was not owned by the hotel. The theft was no fault of the hotel BUT they should in my opinion by more aware of what is happening in their building and increase their security.Travellers beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Great localisation, reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: Shalimar_U
Reviews.Content: The hotel is localised close to airport but on nice silence area. Very good comunication to the city (underground just 5 minutes walk). Shuttle bus to/from airport is additional benefit Clen hotel, comfortable rooms, very good breakfast. Great for stop for sightseeing Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “dumping ground for Iberian Airways”
Reviews.Author: Dev0nmaid
Reviews.Content: Feeling satisfied that Iberian Airways had dealt with our missed flight in a helpful way was short lived. This hotel is in the middle of a graffiti laden housing estate. On arrival it looks deceptive with shiny marble floors and a multitude of restaurants. We were given vouchers for dinner and breakfast and were excited at the prospect of choosing from the varied menu - HOW WRONG WERE WE! We were told veal or pork - choice for vegetarians was potatoes and vegetables. What actually arrived was chips and grey, frozen veg. The meat eaters had bacon and soggy chips. We were given a cornetto for desert and not enough water or wine for our party. The rooms need updating, there are no hairdryers or kettles in the room. During the night more tourists suffering from the incompetence of the airline were checking in ALL NIGHT, meaning the corridors were particularly noisy. The reason 2 points were given was due to the breakfast being ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good for transit - Near airport and free transfer”
Reviews.Author: Marco1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night transiting to another destination. Reasons of choice were that it is modern/comfortable hotel at a reasonable price (50 €/night no breakfast). Hotel is very pleasant and had restaurant, bar, snack bar. There is a playground on the backstreet. It is located in a suburban middle class area of Madrid so nothing to do at night except staying in the hotel grounds. There is a small square with a pizza joint and 2-3 cafés that aren’t attractive but could be an alternative to paying the steep prices of hotel food services (restaurants and snack bars). We ended up ordering pizza from Pizza - hut and ate in the room. They have a Pizza Hut menu in the room. Room itself is very modern and nice with flat screen tv, a beautiful marbled bathroom and a terrace, although there is not much to see from the terrace expect for suburban construction and the dirty pool of the hotel. Pool was unusable (we came in March). Hotel had free transfer to and from the airport. Once you arrive at the airport ask for the transfer bus terminal. There is board with phone numbers for several hotels including tryp Diana. Must have means to make the phone call. For transfer from the hotel to the airport must make a reservation at front desk since mini bus only departs every 30-40 min and has limited seats. Although we reserved and arrived at the scheduled hour of departure of the mini bus it was already completely full with luggage everywhere which I could say was a result of lack of organization. We almost risked not being able to get on the transfer (which would be a risk of missing our flight) but driver arranged a way to get us all there although not the best. Also asked for wake up service and there was a 10 min delay. Hotel is very close from the subway to Madrid so it could be a cheap alternative if you want to visit the city. Hotel itself is nice, comfortable and modern. Nothing to do in the surrounding area. Good for transiting or if you plan to visit Madrid avoiding the more expensive city center hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good value for price”
Reviews.Author: Dorathy S
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a good value, lots of places to eat in the hotel along with places to shop, spa and beauty shop (nothing opens until late though) the room was clean, beds were comfortable and the shuttle runs to the airport regularly.

Reviews.Title: “close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: RVD90277
Reviews.Content: this is a decent hotel near the airport. they have a free 24 hour shuttle so it's convenient if you have a flight. however, the hotel is about 30-40 minutes from the city centre. there is a metro stop about 7 minutes away via walking but it's the very last stop on the line so it's a bit of a ways to get to puerta del sol, plaza mayor, etc. the free shuttle is nice but it still takes some time to get to/from the airport so you do need to schedule it in advance. i called the hotel when i arrived and it took them 30 minutes to pick me up.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable”
Reviews.Author: aktan76
Reviews.Content: Close to Barajas Airport, 300-400m to teh metro station which will take you to down town in 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Kitikat33
Reviews.Content: It was pretty bad. Very dirty. Airline put us up here for the night and that reflects bad on Iberia Airlines as well. We stayed for free and that cost was too much.

Reviews.Title: “Hardest bed in the world!”
Reviews.Author: DaveTrael
Reviews.Content: Not sure how this achieves more than 2 stars. A very mediocre hotel. We arrives around midnight and the hotel obviously caters for cancelled flights as we were stacked up behind 40 or so people checking in. Check in desk were disorganised (Scrum at the desk, no queueing) grumpy and not amazingly efficient, but got checked in after about a 40 min wait. The room I got was on the top floor and was okay, bathroom was clean and nice, but no ironing board in the room. The bed was the most solid thing I have ever found. would have been softer on the floor! fairly pokey size, and the balcony door would not lock. In summary not exactly what I would consider a 4* establishment, much more 2* in my eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat here, super noisy, no ice machine. still could be worse...”
Reviews.Author: Erik G
Reviews.Content: We decide it to stay a few days in Madrid after we stayed in Tenerife. We picked the TRYP cause it was close to the airport and it had shuttle service. Before I say anything else I should say that every one who wrote a review about TRYP is right, this is a dumping pool for canceled Iberia flights, and yes, it is noisy and NO, this isn't a four star hotel. The room itself is pretty clean, nicely furnished with a nice TV. The lobby looks nice and has a magazine and news stand with a few restaurants in it (do not eat there). The food at the Cafeteria is horrible (microwave type pizzas and tapas that have been at the bar too long), the other restaurant has an ala carte type menu that is incredibly over priced for what they are selling. The hotel itself is located around apartment complexes, but it is close to the Metro rail, so you can get to anywhere in the city you want. WiFi is not free and its 20 Euros for 2 days worth (not 48 hours). So if you buy 2 days worth of internet at 10pm, you will only get 24hr plus 2 more hours. There isn't an ice machine (maybe its a European thing) so you cant bring any drinks for tomorrow unless you like them warm. The staff is friendly enough, I really didn't see a problem there. The bathroom was nice and clean, pluming had that problem where you get super hot water then cold water once in a while no mater how hot or how cold you had it. Shaving cream, soap, shampoo, razors, tooth brush and tooth paste was all provided and towels were clean and plentiful. Beds were comfy but the pillows felt kind of flat. The hotel is super noisy, you can hear everything from the people passing by with their luggage to the slamming of all the doors to the people in the other buildings. Still it wasn't a super bad hotel, but they really should remove those 4 starts from their hotel sign.

Reviews.Title: “you'll get no sleep here”
Reviews.Author: robbo52
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on a business trip and slept for possibly 4 hours total. Who ever thought laminate bedroom floors and doors which bang shut were a good idea? Bedroom door and balcony door did not lock so I barricaded myself in (woman travelling alone). Staff very rude and unhelpful, food was stale. Room service is the local pizza takeaway but don't expect any help in ordering. I ended up with a pack of crisps and bar of chocolate from vending machine for dinner. Bathroom dirty too. I travel extensively on business but felt compelled to write this as I've never stayed anywhere quite so unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad trip at this Tryp Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night due to a missed/canceled plane with Iberia in Madrid. This place is really bad. Not 4* at all, maybe a 2+ not more. Noisy, old, bad situation (near motorway junction) and really packed (due to lots of people being in the same case of us). Iberia consider its passenger as "sheep" and send them to this guesthouse. This is a bad joke as you pay a full price plane ticket and get a bad night here with a bad evening meal. No A/C in room so very hot at night. Bad sleep. Never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel I have ever slept in, which pretends to be 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: JosephP_700
Reviews.Content: Like several other reviewers, I was offered to sleep in this terrible hotel by Iberia, due to a missed flight connection. After waiting 45 minutes for the free bus shuttle, I called the hotel to ask if I should take a taxi. 15-20 minutes later the shuttle arrived and took 15-20 other minutes to go to the hotel, because of the traffic and the tour it had to do. The hotel was announced to be at "only 10 minutes from the airport", according to Iberia's desk... Except the hotel registration desk, everything was at least minimal when not insufficient in the Tryp Diana, announced as a 4-star hotel. The carpet in the room corridor was at least 10 years overused. The room door had probably been forced by a screwdriver before; I even tried to open it with my room key-card and only stop to not brake it but I am sure I would manage to open the door, like in an old US motel. I therefore decided to take my laptop with me when I went downstairs to get the offered "last-meal": I had the right for a glass of wine (just one, probably to not risk to get drunk, anyway I could not choose the wine and it was definitively cheap). The fish was overcooked and too salty like the soup (nice combination). I could exchange after some discussion and my request to get an invoice, a 1-hour (of very slow) Internet connection in exchange of the 6-minute phone call Iberia had apparently generously negotiated (which I did not know anyway). The bathroom was spartan and the bathtub was old and also overused - no invitation for a bath. I also refrained to remove my shoes in the room, because the room carpet smelled the dust and was likely inhabited. Phonic insulation was totally lacking (even for a 2-star hotel it would have been bad) and people where arriving and having noisy showers until 2 in the morning and others got up at 4 am and had showers, probably to get their plane. I would therefore never stay on my own in this hotel and would not advise anybody to get there, even for free. Should I again miss a plane in Madrid, I will certainly not accept to go in this hotel again, even if I have to pay another one on my own. I should have better stayed at the airport, because I would not have slept less and could certainly have found better food.

Reviews.Title: “for a one night layover it was fine.”
Reviews.Author: RBG71
Reviews.Content: nice room.... location it is not very convenient nothing to do around there, but I can't still believe the prices some of these hotels they want to charge for WiFI. It should be free!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Iberia Dumping hotel”
Reviews.Author: TubeMap
Reviews.Content: We were "Dumped" into this hotel by Iberia following a delayed flight leading to a missed connection. So rooms paid for by Iberia but if we had paid oursleves I would not have stayed here. We required accomodation for 3 adults and 2 children, which the hotel provided but they had no connecting rooms or family rooms which left the sleeping arrangements rather awkward. We tried to resolve this with Freddy on reception who's only words of English seemed to be "Not my problem". One of the rooms we were issued with absolutley stank of cigarette smoke despite the hotel being non-smoking. This room was changed but only after speaking to someone else other than Freddy on reception as guess what, it wasn't his problem. Iberia obviosuly have a bargain basement deal with this hotel to provide the basic requirements for passengers they Dump at a minimum costs. So the evening meal provided is very basic with only a choice of two starters and two mains, the quality of all of these were poor at best. Desert was cornetto type ice cream, on a take it or leave it basis. Breakfast was okay by Spanish standards. The only saving grace we thought in this hotel were the bars around the reception which served good Tapas and wine/beer. However, that thought changed as given it was a Friday evening the parties tarted in teh bars and went on till 5:30am Saturday, our rooms were on the first floor directly above, so very litlle sleep that night. Complaints were made to, yes you've guessed it, Freddy but again, not his problem. In the morning took a look out of the window at the swimming pool, don't bother taking your trunks here unless you like swimming in green algae. Fundamentally this hotel survives on the incompetentecy of Iberia airlines, if they ever manabe to get people to places on time then this hotel will go bust within days as it purley survives on the airlines business. If you are being dumped by Iberia then make sure they put you into one of the major chain hotels around the airport and kick up before you leave the airport if the try to put you into the Tryp Diana, you'll probably have a better nights sleep on a seat at the airport!

Reviews.Title: “terrible,”
Reviews.Author: meijk
Reviews.Content: Iberia put us here, because we missed our connecting flight. Our room/bathroom was spartan but beds ok. Service was none, staff behaved badly. But the worst were the other guests! Shooting and running (drunk) all night long. I felt unsafe. Dinner in the buffet restaurant awful. Breakfast in the same place ok. Staff also there behaved badly. Not more than 1*

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Merengue70
Reviews.Content: Forced to go to Tryp Diana by Iberia airlines due to overbooking with related change of flight I had a very bad experience in this hotel. Location is OK if you want to stay closed to T1-2-3 of Madrid Barajas airport, not really good if you have to go/come from T4, there are more hotels closer to the new terminal (and much better of course). 4 stars rating is not equal to the level of services offered, never seen anything like this hotel with 4*, expecially in Spain where hotels are very good in average and 3* and 4* are normally very good hotels. Tryp Diana is simply a disaster, old building, poor surroundings, dirty, a lot of noisy overnight. I'm pretty sure that rooms have not been renovated for the last 30 years, bathrooms are terrible, small and very dirty, washing basin was even broken. Synthetic carpets all over the rooms and corridors not cleaned, partially broken (you can see the cement in various parts). I'd never suggest this hotel to everybody and I'd strongly suggest to anybody forced by Iberia to stay overnight in this hotel to refuse the accommodation and to go for another hotel. By the way closed to T4 there are plenty of hotels, 3 and 4 stars, with good quality and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slugette
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel despite reading the reviews here and were very happy we did. We stayed here for a stop over in Madrid and it was perfect for that. We were only there from about midnight until 6am so we literally only needed somewhere near the airport to sleep. The hotel was ideal. The room was great, the bed was massive and the bathroom was clean and modern. The hotel was so much better than the reports here led us to believe! We paid for a taxi from the airport to the hotel as we were too exhausted to think about anything else but jumped on the free shuttle in the morning to take us back. I agree with other reports that this is NOT the place to stay when you come to sightsee in Madrid as like in all cities, the airport is located out of the centre. However, if you need a place to sleep before or after a flight, you will not be disppointed here.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, if that, experience.”
Reviews.Author: Bluepea
Reviews.Content: Yet another hotel that does not deserve its star rating. Room was basic and in need of refurbishment. Construction under way which was noisy and messy. I can only repeat what other Trip travelers have stated: not a four star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This so-called four star hotel is an insult to the Spanish hotel industry!”
Reviews.Author: Damifina
Reviews.Content: This review comes a little bit late due to moving house and other circumstances, but we need to let other travellers know about our experience last year. On October 7th, 2010, we missed our connection flight from Athens due to an air controllers strike over here and had to stay over in Madrid before proceeding to Málaga where we live. We still do not understand why an airline like Iberia (which is NOT a cheap airline!) put travellers up in this dingy hotel. Our first impression in the lobby was that this place was very outdated and needed drastic renovation, but were we in for a real shock when we went up with the elevator and entered the corridor to our room. The carpet was apparently not from the last century but most likely from the century before that, if that is at all possible. The room was soul destroying after the long delays we had already endured, there was nothing appealing in it, the wardrobe doors and surfaces on the furniture and upholstery felt dirty and grimy, the bathroom was below standard with minimum amenities and inadequate toiletries, the toilet was horrific, rusty and stained from calcium and hard water not thoroughly cleaned off on a regular basis. We took a chance and slept in the bed, but were wondering if we were the only creatures on the matress. The breakfast was tolerable but certainly very basic and definitely NOT four star, maybe two star!! We noticed that some parts of the hotel were in the process of being renovated and we wondered if they gave the Iberia travellers the worst rooms available. If that is so that doesn't speak for Iberia either! Should you be unfortunate to miss your flight flying with Iberia, and have to stay overnight in Madrid, please insist on any other hotel than this one. We saw that recently some better reviews about the hotel were posted, so maybe some things have improved, but we certainly do not want to see this place again, not even from the air.

Reviews.Title: “Ropey”
Reviews.Author: delivos
Reviews.Content: It was heavily under construction at the time, and no effort was made to conceal this. Staff seemed stressed, although not adversarial - perhaps a problem with management attitude? Breakfast was OK; lunch was underground and there were only 3 menu choices. The restaurant was open at almost midnight for dinner, and served a free glass of wine with the meal, which you could ask for one top up on - I had had a long day, asked each different waiter for a top-up, and got through about a bottle and a half in the end, so that went well. The room was in moderate condition, the carpeting could do with work; the stairwells felt dilapidated. The hotel area itself has some great tiny shops - I made my way out a little way and found a fantastic small butcher full of little old Spanish ladies, which sold wonderful produce at a low price - but the general location is awful for anything other than aiport access.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable but average”
Reviews.Author: nAndyn
Reviews.Content: We booked the Tryp Diana via lastminute.com as a top secret hotel (had a very pleaseant experience with the top secret hotel choice in Budapest last year) but were a bit disappointed with the Tryp Diana which isnt quite up to the standard of a modern 4 star hotel yet. We could see there is a lot of improvement work going on and it's a massive hotel so surely this takes time. Luckily our room was already done up so top marks for the room and ensuite - with fabulous walk in shower. In terms of the room the only thing to improve is maybe a better selection of english speaking tv channels - although in our case we didnt come to Madrid to watch TV. There is supposed to be quite a few cafes, bars and restaurants in the basement and on the ground floor but most of them were either shut or again didnt look too inviting as they were still awiting the overhaul and there was a really bad smell in the basement so we headed to the city centre for all meals. The reception staff was polite but could do with a bit of extra training in English as most of them didnt seem confident speaking it and tried to pass us on to someone else whenever we aprpoached them. Overall we'd recooment the tryp as a one nighter if you're catching another flight the next day due to the proximity to the airport and free shuttle service. For a sightseeing weekend we wouldnt recommend it due to the time that is spend on transport into the city although the metro station is only 5min walk from the hotel and the cost is only 1Euro per trip but it takes a good 50minutes each way.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room - ok food”
Reviews.Author: rwc1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight waiting for a delayed flight back home to Brazil. The rooms are very old, ugly and smelly, the beds are super tiny e look like from a cheap hostel. Food was OK - good breakfast buffet and salad over lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value - even for free!”
Reviews.Author: Phil_S87
Reviews.Content: Staying here on an unscheduled stopover due to flight delays. Reception staff friendly enough but restaurant staff abysmal. Waited more than 15 minutes, pacing around an empty dining room, for someone to come and give me meal options. Breakfast was poor. Certain things - precut fruit and preserved yoghurt- were actually off.

Reviews.Title: “Tryp Diana (calle Galeon, 24) is the worse hotel in Madrid! ES EL PEOR HOTEL EN Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: CCV_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 4 stars, but should be 1 star. I am talking about Tryp Diana, located in calle Galen 24, close to Barajas Airport. They did this to me: 1. I made my reservation two months ago for visa porposes, but when I tryied to cancell the reservation, they cancelled, but they cashed more than $860. 2. I had to call two months ago to fix the problem, and nobody knew how. 3. So, I requested to re-state my reservation, because I did not want to loose my money. But I asked to change dates and hotel location. 4. Even though they cashed the money without allowing me to cancell the reservation, they did not give me any other option. So, I lost $300 and had to stay in that Hotel. So they impossed me to saty there. 5. Aftrt I went through this since two months before arrival, they gave me a room that I did not requested. Also, the room smelled like dog pee, the carpets were dirty and broken. 6. The administrator did not make any efford to improve anything for me, even though they cashed my money without allowing me to cancell the reservation. He DID NOT CARE AT ALL that they were steeling my money! 7. Also, they do not have Internet, but a machine with coins!!! each 7 minutes cost 1 euro! If you want Internet for longer time, you have to pay extra 1 euros, and they give you 24 hours, but that means that you will have to stay whole time in your rom to make it worth it! 8.Their policies do not say anything that they ask you to do, and they did not do anything when I asked for something. This hotel is THE WORSE HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN IN SPAIN AND IN EUROPE!!! It is like a Jail! I wanted to enjoy my trip, but they made me suffer a lot of stress, and hated to go to the hotel that was very far form the city and that I could not change it becaue they had my money. NEVER GO THERE!!! I am filling out a complaint to give it to the the City Administratuon, the seccion for hotels and turism.

Reviews.Title: “Ok this is no 4 star”
Reviews.Author: TravelOne0101
Reviews.Content: Are you kidding me; do you want rusted toilets. Yes they had a bidet but it was disgusting. And then top it with a very RUDE staff at best. Not had enough; how about in the middle of nowhere........yes they say near the airport but the coach will take at least 45 min to get there.......and there is nothing around. On the plus side, if you pay a pittance for it, it is livable and seemingly safe......but this is no 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: scottyhc
Reviews.Content: Being that the proximity is next to the airport in Madrid, no doubt that is the reason a lot of travellers stay there. The hotel has seen better days and is in need of an remodel to its rooms. I can only speak of the rooms on the 2nd floor but the room we occupied, well the carpet needs replacing or a really good shampoo. A chair in the room that is meant to be used to watch TV or whatever, was badly stained. The bathroom wasn't too bad but the shower was a hand held that had hardly any water pressure and just about scalded you when you used it even when mixing with cold water. The soap dispensers were in place of bars of soap. The hotel lobby itself was clean, bright. Shuttle service to the airport was excellent. Breakfast buffet for two person was 20Euros and wasn't bad but there was nowhere else to eat other than at the airport if you wished to dine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viajero772
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to an early morning flight from Barajas. The room was spacious and comfortable, and had a huge bathroom. The only downside was that the lobby was old and worn. But I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD VALUE,ACROSS FROM MADRID AIRPORT.NICE !!! QUIET !”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: i already stayed 4 times in this nice hotel,which is just 5 minutes from madrid international airport and a short walk to the metro,subway,station.very spacious rooms and nice staff.very helpful.very professional.will stay again in a few weeks. big tubs and clean tooms.at least one hotel in spain not even i can criticize. try booking it on the net,because rackrate might be in the 100 to 120 euros. i usually get it from the 50 to 70 euro range. breakfast is 10 euros extra but i would recommend a coffeeshop in the city center.it is just more spanish :) to have a tostada with olive oil and a nice coffee in front of puerta de toledo:) o en plaza mayor:) nice,spacious,quiet !!! rooms. it feels like a crowne plaza or hilton in the us,just at a really nice price !

Reviews.Title: “not a four stars”
Reviews.Author: sm115
Reviews.Content: our stay was paid by Iberia because of flight connection missed. not happy. hotel overcrowded. rooms are old. bathroom was not clean. dirty towels.... missing toiletries...

Reviews.Title: “A Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: josebenjamin
Reviews.Content: In a recent trip to several spanish cities (April 2011), we needed to stay for one night at a hotel near Madrid Airport. The Tryp Diana hotel seemingly fit all our requirements; close to Terminal one, a courtesy van to and from the airport, and an early breakfast buffet that starts at 6:30 AM. The morning of our departure, we were a few minutes early and we decided to come down to the breakfast room. Once there we found all the lights on, apparently all the food in place, all the doors open, and nobody in charge. Since it was about 6:20 AM we thought it would be fine if we sat down for breakfast. It was just a few minutes later that a woman employee came to the room and started to shout, telling us that it was still not open and we should not be there. I tried to explain that we saw everything ready, the lights on, and that we thought a few minutes should not matter. She angrily replied that the lights were not all on, and that it was only 6:20 AM !!!!!!!. My wife and I offered to leave the room and I asked the woman to calm down or otherwise I will have to go to the front desk and report her, she defiantly replied, "I will go with you". I told her that it would not be necessary and I will do it right away, once at the front desk the people in charge where surprised about this incident and told me that they will talk to her. We went back to the breakfast room (it was now 6:30AM), and finished our badly interrupted breakfast. I also want to add that the breakfast ingredients were not of good quality and some were not fresh. All this incident has been reported by letter to the people in charge. My suggestion to all travelers would be to stay away of this hotel (there are several other available), but if you need to stay there, just take the room, go early to the airport and have some breakfast over there. Otherwise most of the staff was polite, and the courtesy van was on time. The rooms were not as good as those of a true four star establishment and there was a lot of construction going around. JB Esquivel H

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cmegoaway
Reviews.Content: Simply be aware of these items... The internet is €12.00 per 24 hours and it may take the whole 24 hours to get the first page to load, extremely slow!!!. When you inform them about it, they shrug their shoulders and tell you to take it up with the manager in the morning. The manager says "if you had brought this to our attention last night we could have removed the charge, but now there is nothing we can do"!! Prepare to be overcharged! Shuttle, yes it is a free shuttle to and from the airport, but it only runs every 75 minutes. Prepare to wait!! Shower...water pressure is great until you turn on the shower head then the water barely trickles out. Prepare for a bath or a very long shower! On the good side...They have installed fast efficient elevators recently. Rooms were of sufficient size and comfortable for the price charged.

Reviews.Title: “Iberia Airport Dump”
Reviews.Author: Desert_Quark
Reviews.Content: When you are stranded in Madrid overnight Iberia will put you into a Solmelia hotel chain and the cheapest Airport location seems to be the Tryp Diana. Hotel which greets you with unearned 4 stars. To begin, one cannot get there easily, the bus cruises the small streets endlessly and the driver is not always obeying the rules of the law - to be safe I took a taxi back next morning - the taxi driver told me that there is no exit from any highway connecting this part of town to the world. Upon arrival I was received by riot police looks receptionists who send you to "eat' underground so as to break the check-in line of those arriving. To what I could see nobody was allowed to check in without going underground, and eating. And yes, the dining is in a basement room without windows. The food is directly from the deep freezer - the customer number is unpredictable, on the bright side, the people in the restaurant were friendly, worked hard trying to please everyone. The room was not 4-stars, but basic, needing a face lift. I was on the European first floor (that would be US 2nd floor), back windows were a yard above garden level in back of the hotel which thus must be on a slope and till my arrival were unsecured, so anyone could find the back way to the hotel which is also undergoing some construction work.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient lay-by hotel, but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: kuen74
Reviews.Content: A pretty standard lay-by hotel. I got a room for a day at 49 Euros. They provide a 24 hour free shuttle service to and from the airport, however the hotel can still be reached by Metro (nearest station being Alameda de Osuna, and getting to town centre is approximately 30 min from Alameda).Walking from Metro to the hotel is approximately 7 mins. Hotel feels slightly old and run down, lifts and corridor especially seems old; but the rooms are generally clean, nicely decorated and comfortable (I was in room 714, but again am rather curious as I have read different experiences on the rooms from other travelers and perhaps wonder there are different standards for each rooms, thus this could be rather subjective). Was there for a 12 hour lay-by, hotel provided a 4am free shuttle transfer to the airport which was convenient, and the whole drive took approximately 7 minutes, though waiting for the shuttle to the airport was about 20mins given that the bus was on a regular schedule. Wifi is payable and there is a coin operated desktop which allows for internet access but cost generally do not come cheap as well, did not try breakfast given the amount of time I was there. Would suggest this hotel as a good lay-by hotel though I do see Hi-tech Hotel just a few doors down, however have not seen their facilities yet, but would definltely say this is at most a 2.5 to 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump. It should be a no star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: edwin1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights. The hotel was about the same as it was in the 1960's or 70´s when it was probably built. Two of three elevators did´t work. The only dining room available was big enought for about 30 people. With the exception of a ladly receptionist and one man the receptionists weren´t friendly. The manager was especially unfriendly. The carpet long since needed replacement. Talk between rooms was extremely bad. There was practically no air from the airconditioning because obviously lhe filter hadn´t been changed. At midnight a woman in the next room started a loud conversation. Two calls to reception for relief produced nothing. Banging on the wall did. There is no information in the room about services, if any offered. This hotel is in no way a four stary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - until renovation is completed.”
Reviews.Author: Meigas_fora
Reviews.Content: Stranded in Madrid because of delays caused by strikes in France and non-strikes in Spain, the airline sent about 200 of us to this hotel. "It's a 4 star hotel", they told us at the airport. I'm sure it was when it first opened. Hallway to the room (4th floor) was filthy at best, room numbers have fallen off, doors miss bottom parts. In the bathroom, the sink had cigarrette "fingerprints", bath tub hadn't been properly cleaned in a long time -same for the carpet. I could hear my neighbors talking next door. Virtually no toiletries -even 3 star hotels in Spain have a better stock! Service at dinner was definitely not 4-star. Menu was like a Goldilocks experience -soup was cold, fish was ok, veggies were hot. Buffet breakfast was ok, but some bread was stale, and coffee wasn't good. Again, not 4-star. Nice TV, sheets were clean. Staff was nice, but didn't really go the extra mile. Airport shuttle is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “It works for us!”
Reviews.Author: pimpilipausa
Reviews.Content: We've been in this hotel many times, and yes, sometimes the rooms have not been up to a 4 star rating. The last two times, we were lucky to be placed in a renovated room which was very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The only annoying thing is that it seems to always be under renovation. The shuttle to the airport has always been on time and with the metro so close by, it is very convenient to go and spend time in downtown Madrid. The breakfast is very good and the bar downstair has good "tapas" and drinks if you don't feel like going out. Over all, we will continue staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: joabla
Reviews.Content: It is a 4* but it should probably be one or even less. This hotel is terrible in every single aspect you may consider. Staff at front desk are slow, rude at times. Lift is scary at least. They have two kinds of rooms: news renovated ones (which are decent) and old filthy ones (which are really terrible and should have been renovated 10-15 years ago). Breakfast is not even worth mentioning. Well, maybe yes. Take it only if it is free. It not even worth 1 euro. They have a lot of people that are sent to this hotel from airlines when cancellations and delays occur, so I suppose they just could not care less for clients. The only good thing: 24 hour shuttle to the airport and that normally they have great prices. At the lobby there are a couple of cafeterias which offer decent prices and quality for tapas and meals.

Reviews.Title: “Does what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Ruralscotland
Reviews.Content: Don't know what people are whining about. This is a perfectly okay hotel. We used it for an overnight stay before heading off into the rural areas of Spain. Despite arriving at the airport at 11.00pm the shuttle bus picked us up within 20 minutes, and we were in the hotel 10 minutes later. There were two staff on, no language problems. They had a cafe still going doing beer, coffee, and tapas, about 20 euros for the two of us - what more do you want! The room was modern, clean and well maintained. All the showers and stuff worked, and there were decent toiletries provided. We had a balcony if we had wanted to use it. The hotel faces onto a busy road, but our room looked out over a quiet garden square with trees. It was quiet enough. Breakfast was fine, I have had worse in paradores, it will keep you going for the morning. When we had to go back to the airport the following morning to pick up our hire car, the shuttle bus got us back within 20 minutes again. All in all, I would be more then happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, did the job”
Reviews.Author: TonyW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on Business. Paid about 50 Euros so very good value. The hotel is a bit dated but overall I would stay again if Im in Madrid and need to stay near the airport. Plus points - A couple of authentic bars and restaurants right next to the hotel, small shop 5 mins walk away, metro stop 10 minutes walk away, free shuttle to the airport Minus Points - Internet was very slow at about 10pm (unusable), Ok in the morning though.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here unless you must”
Reviews.Author: michaelgarrettbrown
Reviews.Content: The staff do their best but this hotel was last renovated in about 1970. Not much apart from the service is still working.

Reviews.Title: “really is not a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: morgyn
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel as i needed to get a connection flight the next day from madrid airport,sorry i did! its an awful hotel, the rooms were very smelly, hot (heating could not be turned off due to faulty wiring) dirty, and old fashioned and the staff were very ignorant, the rooms are not very secure with signs on the doors of previous break ins,one of the elevators was not working . the restaurant in the building is a rip off , and they are waiting for travelers so as to overcharge them.there is a free bus to airport, but you need to leave early as it takes a while to get there. I would rather sleep in the airport before i stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Horrible airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: gola42139
Reviews.Content: This is was the worst airport hotel I have stayed in (and I travel frequently). The walls were paper thin, the room and hotel had unusual (and unpleasant) odors, the bathroom was quite musical all night, the front desk staff was quite surly, and the airport shuttle was a mad dash by a large group of unhappy travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Sarius_Artavius
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why this hotel has got such a bad review status! Me and a friend stayed there for a week and we had no troubles at all! Our room was huge and we even had a dining table, we only paid just over 300 euros for the week! The staff were very friendly and spoke good English and were always happy to help! It was only a 10 minute walk from the Almeda de Osuna Metro station, which is at the end of the line on line 5, which will take you straight into the centre of town in about 20-30 minutes! The drinks in the bar can be quite expensive however, and the shuttle bus at the airport took a while to pick us up, but promptly took us to the airport for our return flight! Very clean, very nice and well decorated...I don't know where the other reviewers were staying in this hotel, but it seems a completely different hotel to me! (I have reviewed the right hotel, if that's what you are thinking!)

Reviews.Title: “Detoured here because of missed Iberia connection”
Reviews.Author: WhatMickyEats
Reviews.Content: Like others, we were put up here by Iberia when flights were delayed out of Madrid. It was the most depressing place we've spent a night. We waited over 2 hours for the shuttle to pick us up and then the front desk was very unfriendly - almost grumpy - when we arrived. Although they offered us complimentary lunch - we checked in at the time lunch was closing - so I specifically asked if we would still be allowed to eat. We were told yes, so we rushed up to our room really quick to put our bags away and came back down to only be TURNED AWAY. We were starving and out of Euros, but had enough to at least get some bottle water from the vending machine. We decided to shower and rest before dinner opened up in four hours. The room itself was average with a nice large bathroom, but the television was small and did not work well. The ventilation system must have been broken because we often smelled smoke or odd fish smells from the cafeteria below. Unfortunately the location did not seem to be convenient enough to even venture out and explore the city of Madrid before heading back out to the airport. The one positive thing was that the shuttle was on time to take us back to the airport the next day and being so close, we had plenty of time to check in and make way to our gate. We were NOT going to miss another flight out of Spain!

Reviews.Title: “Another OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJTravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was close to the Madrid Airport and it provided free shuttle service. It is located in a neighborhood of apartments and is not particularly attractive. Had my wife been traveling with me, we would not have stayed at this hotel. The staff was friendly but limited in English. Internet access was available at a fee of 25 Euros for 24 hours or 12 Euros for one hour. The air conditioning worked well in the rooms. We ate dinner in El Bergantin, one of the hotel's restaurants. The food was good but the staff was inattentive; in addition, smoking was permitted in this restaurant, and one couple left before they finished their meal because of their placement next to another couple who smoked throughout the meal. This was a fairly inexpensive hotel, so you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “good location, estimated standard”
Reviews.Author: Shalimar_U
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3 nights in this hotel and found it appreciate. Very clean, large rooms, new arranged bathroom, individually operated air condition. Quiet area, even though nearby to airport. Wonderful surrounding - green, clean and quit area. Close to metro station (10 minutes walk). Friendly staff and rich breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: CanAmTravelers
Reviews.Content: We were put up at this hotel en route to London, what a disappointment. This place looks like it has not been updated since the 1950's, none of the staff knew how to place a long distance phone call to our hotel in London, the food was disgusting and I ended up with hives. Only good thing was.....check out the next day!!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient!”
Reviews.Author: LucasLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We were stuck in Madrid due to the volcanic eruptions and Iberia put us in this hotel (and paid for accomodation and food!). While this hotel is maybe not a dream holiday, it is pretty close to the airport. But most of all, we were impressed by its efficiency (which is not a given in Spain). Check in was straight forward and they were well prepared for such situations. Dinner was ok, but the breakfast buffet was great! So if you need a hotel close to the airport, this one is worth considering although I have no idea whether it is cheap or not.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all :)”
Reviews.Author: cerbera69
Reviews.Content: Hotel seems a little dated, Decor and design typically 70's ... Jade green bathrooms !! 3 Beds to a room, very comfortable. Breakfast good, plenty of selection both hot and cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very convenient”
Reviews.Author: RedheadEngineer
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at this hotel for years, and it's a bit worn in spots, but still can't be beat for value and convenience - as long as you aren't driving or taking a taxi, since accessibility is somewhat difficult. With the 24 hour free airport shuttle and nearby metro, it doesn't make sense anyway. There are 2 bars and a restaurant in the small shopping center attached to the hotel, and more in the neighborhood behind it, including an Argentine steakhouse, a good Chinese place, pizza, and a couple of traditional Spanish restaurants. Also, a great bakery/coffee place if you don't want to have breakfast at the hotel. However, the buffet is 9.95 euros, and 2 for 1 with the Melia MAS card, so a very good value. The best addition is the new Alalmeda de Osuna Metro station, about a half mile walk, which is much more convenient than going to the airport, and it's in zone 1, so only 1 euro to go to the center of Madrid. If you're looking for nightlife, this isn't the place, but at 50-55 euros for a double room, it's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Allisonr30
Reviews.Content: Fabulous rooms, great pool. lots of food options, close to airport with free transfer! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice Near Madrid Airport”
Reviews.Author: ehb22
Reviews.Content: We quite liked the Tryp Diana. It's in a lovely, leafy neighborhood very near the airport and, while the center of Madrid is more than half an hour away by subway, the nearest subway stop to the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk. The price was certainly right, and the room was roomy and comfortable, looking out on a little park. Highly recommended if you would like a place near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Airport Hotel with Free Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: JohnT_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice while in Spain. First night upon arrival in Madrid and liked it enough to stay the last night before leaving. Comfortable, Clean rooms, 5 minutes from Airport, Free Airport Shuttle(Although one should call (--) upon arrival-50 cents from payphone in the terminal-They will send the shuttle to get you), Staff spoke English, some were somewhat rude but others were very helpful. Might be difficult to find with a car as it is a confusing maze getting out of the airport. 5 minute walk to Metro stop-Alameda de Osuna-15-20 minutes to Puerta del Sol by Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel - RUDE staff and dirty dingy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Noush01
Reviews.Content: I had a 6 am flight and was looking for a hotel near the airport that offered free shuttle service to the airport so that I wont have to take a cab at 4 in the morning. Through some research I came across this hotel. I had heard of Sol Melia properties and thought that as a chain this must meet minimum standards (at the least). I was really really disapointed in the hotel and the hotel staff. Hotel Shuttle: We called the hotel to tell them when we would like to be picked up at the airport but they said to call them when we we arrived (which we did) but we ended up waiting over 45 minutes for shuttle. Front desk reps: RUDE, RUDE, RUDE, RUDE. I am a frequent international traveler and have stayed at all ranges of hotels (from small mom & pop to 5 star luxury resorts) and can honeslty say that I have never experienced this type of rudeness from all memebers of the front desk staff. The hotel room looked clean on the surface but I saw a few spiders (yes, not kidding, small spiders) throughout the room. I was just shocked and front desk didnt bother coming up to see for themselves. Internet connection: the computers in the lobby were not connected to any printers. Inorder to print your boarding card, you need to save your boarding card on the hotels computer and email it to the front desk. I just dont understand how a hotel has 4 to 6 computers but not one printer for their guests convininece. Overall, location wise it was close to the airport (but 20 euro ride from the city) but I will never stay at a Tryp hotel or recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended. No English spoken, did not give wake up, late for plane because of it.”
Reviews.Author: Travelcatmeow
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice lobby and great towels and bathroom, but the staff is not helpful and down right hostile. I requested a wake up call and reserved a spot on the airport shuttle the night I checked in, they did not do the wake up call. They would not negotiate the rate to make up for the fact that they had not made the call and asked what time my flight was and when I told them they shrugged and said it would be fine. The reception staff also spoke very, very, little English, and to claim they are a four star business hotel, they need to have staff who have passing English.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: okarr
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at hotel but got lost on my way from Metro station going to my hotel around midnight. Had two small children and went into hotel to ask front desk to call cab. Front desk person said cab was called but cab never showed up. Front desk was not sympathetic at all and I personally don’t think they called cab. Would not stay at hotel due to poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: aott02
Reviews.Content: We got to airport at 11pm, and I called the hotel for a shuttle at 11:20. The shuttle did not show up until 12:30am. The hotel did not answer my calls, so I couldn't figure out why it took the shuttle 1 and 1/2 hours to get there when they claimed the hotel is less than 10 minutes away. When we got to the hotel at 12:40am, there were only two people working at the front desk and a very long line of customers. So, it took quite a while to get our rooms. The rooms and the hallways are pretty disgusting. The lobby is nice and pretty and it has about 4 bars, a couple of restaurants, and at least 1 nightclub. But the rooms and the hallways, seriously, you feel dirty just being there. Our view was of the pool, which was filled with lovely green water and it gave the impression that some beast lived underwater. It was disgusting, just like the room and the rest of the hotel. We only stayed one night, and the next day got back to the airport. I would not recommend this for longer than 1 night, I have stayed in better hostels.

Reviews.Title: “only favorable comment would be hotel has airport transportation”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaAlicia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hotel for two nights in March before coming back to US. We had rented a car and found the hotel extremely difficult to find. Called the hotel several times and stopped to ask on the way another several times. We are pretty good at following directions but it was quite difficult just getting back to the hotel on both days. Also, metro stop is a good walk away. The only reason to stay here, I think ,would be for an early flight out of the airport. The room was reasonable and clean; had a balcony, and the staff was polite. We had to keep the patio doors open all night because if they were closed it was like being closed in an oven. Air conditioniing was noted in the hotel description but we were told since it was still winter the air conditioning was not working yet for the year. We followed the airport transport in the morning to th airport. I would never call this a four star hotel and don't understand how it could be listed as one.

Reviews.Title: “Gypped”
Reviews.Author: 6757Expat
Reviews.Content: On the early evening of my arrival, I asked to hotel desk whether they had a place to store luggage after checking out the next morning, they told me no. So, I paid for another day's stay at the hotel just to have my luggage stay in the room while I was out touring Madrid (my flight wasn't until 11:30 pmish that night). While waiting for the hotel bus to take me to the airport, I noticed a door across from me that had a suitcase sign....methinks this was the luggage storage room. Gypped, yep.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: fleetstar
Reviews.Content: Tryp Diana is perfect for an early morning flight from Madrid. Less than 5 minute walk from last stop on the #5 metro, plus free, 5 minute shuttle to the airport. Hotel is in quiet neighborhood. Large rooms, comfortable bed, clean bathroom. Typical hotel food at acceptable prices. Service was friendly and English was well understood. Last minute pricing through Booking.com was well below other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Only use as airport stopover, no more than 1 night!!!”
Reviews.Author: bedlem
Reviews.Content: This was very convienent for us with only 8 hours between flights. This hotel is situated very close to the Madrid Airport and has free transfers which are easy to arrange. The hotel itself was very outdated with thread bare carpets and motheaten curtains. If we had not checked in I would have assumed it was closed down years before.For what we paid we could not complain and it was better than sleeping on the seats at the airport, If you are thinking of staying here make sure its only for 1 night as a stopover and not for a break.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: SDF-ky
Reviews.Content: Booked three rooms here on business trip. Not fancy, but clean. Staff helpful. Shuttle service fine but only runs on half hour, and you'll need the phone number to call for shuttle upon arrival. On second stay booked a room that included a frig and hair dryer, which appears to be a step up from their normal room. Only about 45 Euros and a much better room than the regular room.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable room - eat elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: CityTravel-7
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Madrid for a night after missing our connecting flight home. Since it was the airline at fault, they provided accommodation and food for the stay. The double room was modern, clean with good size bathroom (the largest of our 5 hotel rooms in Europe this trip). We received vouchers for meals. We should have eaten elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to get out!”
Reviews.Author: HamlynTenerife
Reviews.Content: The rooms were tired and smelly (tobacco, damp, etc) The food was awful - we had supper - expensive and mediocre. Service was non-existent. We helped an elderly gentleman with his suitcases whilst hotel staff stood and watched him struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Great for airport stop over”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: The Tryp Diana is a modern 4 star hotel built to a fairly predictable large chain format. Rooms are plain and with modern décor. The standard double room I was booked into had a king sized bed, multi channel TV, in room safe and good heater / air conditioning controls. It also had a balcony although the view of the apartment block opposite wasn’t really a view to remember. The bathroom was particularly large and well equipped although the lack of a bath mat for the shower was a noticeable omission as the bath had quite a smooth slippery surface. There is a restaurant and separate cafeteria for snack type meals. I only tried the cafeteria where food was fast and plain but well cooked and reasonably priced. There are also 3 bars, including one that did Tapas, which was very good. There is also a number of small shops including a travel agent a masseuse. I found service to be excellent with friendly staff and the addition of a free 24 hour shuttle bus to the airport was a bonus. The hotel is located in a residential area about 10 minutes from the airport. It’s a great location for people wanting a stopover before catching an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Run Away”
Reviews.Author: Graciesmom_1521
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our last night in Spain. The lobby is somewhat new...but it is all downhill from there. The carpet in the hallway was at least 30 years old, dirty and ragged. When we arrived, there was rusty water coming from the pipes. Dinner was okay, but when we returned to our rooms, there was NO water. The front desk was less than helpful and we when asked for bottled water (since we had soap on our hands and could not wash it off), we were told to call room service. The twin beds were on plastic slats wih no box springs and were very uncomfortable. The television reception was sketchy at best. Some of the rooms in our group included breakfast (if you call breakfast canned fruit and prepaged pastries) and others did not and we all paid the same rate. The shuttle to the airport was okay and only took about 10 minutes to Terminal 1. This was by far one of the worst hotels where I have ever stayed....we are going back in a few weeks and will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with lots to do”
Reviews.Author: mia48
Reviews.Content: just came back from this hotel after a four night stay and had read the negative reviews so wasnt expecting anything special. All I can say is that i was very happy with every aspect of my stay and would definately go back. the rooms were very spacious and spotlessly cleaned every day. the reception staff couldnt do enough to help and spoke good english, there was some very good bars and resteraunts all reasonably priced and the pool was nice and there was lots of sunloungers. the area is easily accessable to a supermarket and local bars. the metro a short walk takes you all over madrid for 1 euro per trip. the shuttle service to the airport very convienient and regular.

Reviews.Title: “good for a one nighter”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_traveller32
Reviews.Content: i stayed here due to an early flight from Barajas airport and it provided a complimentary airport shuttle. i paid 56 euros for a nights stay which isnt too bad as ive seen this hotel at a much higher rate. it is a 4 star hotel but ive seen better 4 star hotels in spain, the staff are friendly enough and there are restaurants/bars/shops on the lobby floor of the hotel. the room was good, spacious, massive outside balcony but nothing to stand there and be gobsmacked about. no news channels on the tv which was quite an annoyance for me, and no mini-bar. the bathroom was nice, very powerful shower (didnt want to get out of it) the bar in the lobby "bar diana" was nice small and friendly, prices are horrific. they showed bull fighting on all the tv's in the bar, its not my thing as i dont like animal cruelty and they wouldnt change channel when asked, even though there was 3 massive tv's in there. they said bull fighting is a spanish tradition and it stays on. recap.... not a bad place, not easy to find on foot. nice size room, i was in 124. close to airport. free shuttle bus to and from airport. IMPORTANT NOTE... I WAS WAITING FOR THE AIRPORT SHUTTLE AT 4.10AM IT DIDNT COME TIL 04.50 And he had to leave people and come back for them, i was lucky as got on first time. happy travels. Preston.

Reviews.Title: “Effiecient hotel for a work trip”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Teee
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel close to both the airport and the conference centre at short notice and this hotel had a room. I can understand some of the comments regarding the 4* not being worthy and if your trip was for leisure then I am not sure you would be happy however for a business trip it was fine. The reception staff were helpful, the choice of food/bars were extensive, I did not feel intimidated at any time being a lone woman, it was very quick and easy to get online in the room and the breakfast was standard Spanish 'fodder' - which I like. I cannot find fault with anything about my stay but I do agree with the 'looking tired' comments of other reviewers. If I have paid the cost of the night I would have been disappointed with the overall quality feel of the hotel. However I would not hestitate to stay here again if attending FITUR or travelling for business.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Don't be put off by the negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: ColinL10NCB
Reviews.Content: Cannot understand the negative reviews. My wife and I spent 2 nights at the hotel, and had a very enjoyable stay. We chose the hotel for its close proximity to the airport (as we were leaving on an early morning flight). The 24 hour complimentary shuttle bus service was regular and efficient Although the hotel is well away from the centre of Madrid, this did not cause any problems as there is a metro station (Alameda de Osuna) fairly close by - approx. 10 minutes walk. From here you can get to all the tourist spots for around 1 euro. The breakfast buffet was varied, plentiful, and enjoyable. Maybe the hotel does need a 'face lift'- some of the paintwork may be a little shabby - the basin in the bathroom did show signs of wear, and if you looked for it, you could find bits of 'threadbare' carpet - but this does not detract from what is in my opinion a really good hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LBC80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice and worth the money. Looked like it had recently gone through renovation, so the room was very fresh and new. The three bars downstairs were very enjoyable and the pool, yet small, was very peaceful. Would definitely suggest this hotel if you are looking to spend a night prior to your flight out of Madrid. The shuttle service was puntual and very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, close to airport”
Reviews.Author: reinadezapatos
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay in the Tryp Diana because I have stayed in the Tryp chain before and liked it and because of the Tryp Diana's proximity to Barajas airport.
