Tryp Diana offers a 24-hour shuttle service to the airport (shuttle arrives every 15 minutes), which we found incredibly convenient, especially in the early hours of the morning. The hotel is located approximately 10-15 minutes from the airport. On the way in, we took a cab and it seemed to take a lot longer to arrive than when we left on the shuttle the next morning. FYI: cab cost us about 15 euros. The hotel is on a street with several other hotels. It seemed to be a fairly residential neighborhood. From the very spacious balcony of our room, we noticed a nice, peaceful park and playground. The room itself was very large, with a comfortable queen-sized bed, table and chair, desk, computer hookups, and TV. There is also a nice tour book of Madrid to browse through. Finding a welcome with my name on the TV screen when we entered was a nice touch! The bathroom provided oversized, plush bath towels, 2 hand towels, and several amenities such as shoe shine, comb, and an in-shower shampoo/body wash dispenser. For dinner, we ate at the "cafeteria" downstairs. There is a small bar and dining area. The menu was pretty limited, but fine for our purposes; 2 meals, 2 drinks and a dessert cost us about 25 euros. The lobby offers 4 computers with pay-per-use internet service. When checking my email, I also noticed that there was another restaurant/bar behind us and, past the front desk, the breakfast dining area. We also saw a different bar where folks were watching the Eurocopa. You will not go hungry if you stay in this hotel! In the morning, we decided to check out the breakfast buffet (open at 6 am), but it was 17 euros, which was too steep for us. Instead, we had a coffee at the bar (where we'd had dinner the night before). The first airport shuttle was packed at 6:50 am, so we waited for the next one, which got there very quickly. I was very pleased with the efficiency and comfort of this hotel. It allowed us to get a good night's sleep before our transatlantic flight early the next morning. Room cost us about $140 total. I would not spend this much on an airport hotel room in the States (tend to be cheaper), but I felt like it was worth it this time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoxanaRegue
Reviews.Content: Terrible, Noisy, Worn out Staff not capable 2 stars hotel maximum NOT A 4 stars!!!!!!!!!! Expensive (175 $ for one night, plus 22$ each breakfast, 22$ parking per day) Bathroom from the 70's, shower dificult to graduate. Noisy cleaning staff. Dirty walls. Old carpets. In pretty bad conditions, avoid this hotel. Good location, but many more in the same location. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: ChopperBarton
Reviews.Content: This hotel has aged…and not well. My wife and I spent just one night here in late May before relocating to the new Hilton hotel just a short walk away. A small taste of the problems we “enjoyed” at the Diana: Airport shuttle operator seemed very unhappy to pick us up at airport – not sure what he thinks his job description is; Hotel had lost our reservation – we were told we had not made one and I think they expected an apology; Elevator to room on seventh floor not working – no staff available to help with luggage; Threadbare carpets on most floors accented by water damaged walls; Broken lock on our room door meant room was not securable – I guess the seven floor climb would put most people off; Security box in room had been broken into and therefore not serviceable – I slept with my passport and cash in my pajamas; Non smoking room had strong smell of smoke and included smoke damage above aircon vent – may have been an artistic touch but I doubt it; Aircon did not work; No water, coffee, kettle or bar fridge in room – funny how most hotels have started supplying these since 1970; Swimming pool had been drained – perhaps in the 90’s. For just a thirty percent premium in price the Hilton hotel was a dream in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Paul9876
Reviews.Content: I decided to move to a hotel close to the airport because I had an early morning flight home. But it took me about 40 minutes to find the place, which is hidden away down a dark freeway access road. When I checked in I mentioned that I wanted the 9 euro charge for breakfast removed because I was leaving so early but they refused because they said I had reserved it that way. Their breakfast room opened an hour and a half after I needed to leave. They said I could get breakfast in their cafeteria. A quick bowl of spaghetti with meat sauce in the cafeteria was basic and edible. On the way to my room I noticed that one of the three elevators were broken. The hallway on my floor had the most threadbare carpet I have seen since staying in an old Russian hotel in Beijing in 1997. The room was okay but worn, smelled of smoke, and the air conditioning didn't work. I had to open the patio door wide to cool down and air out the room. I couldn't find a switch to turn off the bright patio light. The tv had only one english-language channel, CNN Europe. I asked for a wake-up call and it turned out to work by turning on the tv and raising the volume continuously. Since I was already in the shower, I'm sure this woke up some of my neighbors. At check out I again asked them to remove the breakfast charge and they again refused, insisting that I could eat in the cafeteria. I didn't want to eat -- I wanted to get to the airport and checked in for my flight! Fortunately, I had a rental car and so didn't have to undergo the horrors of their shuttle. After getting home I again wrote them about the breakfast charge but they never answered. Stay away from this place. It's a dog.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, Dreadful, Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Helen987
Reviews.Content: It's fair to say we had a pretty bad experience with the Tryp Diana but in the interest of fairness I shall start with the positives (it won't take long): - Great location - 10-15mins from airport yet no noise from planes overhead. - Nice looking lobby - Efficient receptionist (though it was 1am when we checked in so hardly rush-hour) - Room was quite clean. That's the positives. Now the negatives: - The hotel claims to be 4 star, and perhaps 30 years ago when the interiors were first put in it was of that standard - it most certainly is not now - I'd say 2 star at best. - Despite being told the minibus would pick us up from the airport in 6-7mins, it took 1hr 40mins for it to come. Twice it sped past the pick-up area at about 40kmph but despite diving out in front of it, it "didn't see us". Once the driver did stop he gave out to us for standing in the wrong place (we were about 5meters from where he thought we should be - bear in mind it was after midnight so we were pretty much the only people anywhere near it). He also didn't speak a word of english which wasn't ideal. - The hotel lobby has been renovated but leads you into a false sense of security. Once you step into the ancient lifts you start to fear the worse and as soon as you see the corridors and rooms themselves you start to worry - old, tatty and dated. Overall, it's true our bad experience with the mini-bus tainted the overall stay but even without that, the awful standard of decor in the rooms would have still only give it a 2-3/5 rating. The location is good but I simply couldn't recommend it unless the alternative was sleeping outside in the rain, and even then it would be a close call......

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: brebers
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel to stay in the night before a flight. We chose this hotel because it was reasonably priced and was listed as a 4 star. Although I would never consider this a 4 star hotel by American standards, it was a decent hotel for one night before a flight. Bed was all right, the room in general was ok. The bathroom was quite nice. The breakfast was actually very good, we were pleasantly surprised at the array of offerings. It looked like they were remodeling when we were there so maybe it will be much nicer soon.

Reviews.Title: “A fraud”
Reviews.Author: mastorna
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip, and stayed for 2 days at the tryp Diana the overall quality is VERY POOR: stained carets, broken plugs, dirty bathroom, horrible bed. The ratio price/quality is definitely negative. And the staff won't give you any help in making the stay better. I do suggest NOT to go in that hotel. For the first time in my life I also wrote an Official Claim for the ministry of tourism, as I think that such a structure is a minus for Madrid impact on a tourist (or a businessman, which is worst in some cases) mm

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: aetsy
Reviews.Content: Sad and tired looking place, where nothing is wrong in the strict sense of the word, but nothing is quite right either. It just doesn't feel nice, doesn't feel clean and doesn't look inviting. Bathroom was the best bit about it, quite modern (probably refurbished very recently). Shuttle bus service was ok though, pretty quick. Breakfast was good too, but WAY overpriced! Honestly, no way that it was worth 17 euros...

Reviews.Title: “Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bosques
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Diana for one night was organised and paid for by my airline after bad weather caused me to miss my connecting flight in Madrid. It is a large tired 70s style airport hotel which I would never have chosen to stay in, however the staff were very helpful, the bar was open very late and the breakfast buffet was very nice. I have no idea what the price for a room here is, if it's cheap and you want to stay in an airport hotel, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Hardly four stars...”
Reviews.Author: zolagola
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights, apart from the free shuttle to and from the airport it would be hard to find a reason to stay there again. The airport pickup van took 45mins to arrive, but check-in was prompt as we were only told our room number. Other information like breakfast times and prices (overpriced at 17+ EUR), hotel facilities, check-out-times - nada, nothing, niente. Also nothing in the room itself (which was a bit dirty but had a nice and comfy kingsize bed, the bathroom was ok, but walls were too thin), only some general information in Spanish - not what you´d expect from a Sol Melia affiliate. Staff was trying to be friendly but not always fluent in English. But when we wanted to change the room in the middle of the night because of noise, they organised a new room without issues. There are two internet PCs in the lobby, unfortunately they deactivedted Javascript so it´s pretty much useless unless you just want to read news. TV channels - only 2 English ones available (CNN, Eurosport). The next metro is only a 5 min walk away, it takes you 30mins to get to the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Felt cheated even though it was free. THAT'S how bad this hotel is.”
Reviews.Author: RTOLondon
Reviews.Content: Iberia were keen to mention how nice the hotel was as their mistakes and technical problems meant that we would have to stay overnight in Madrid. Iberia are liars. The transfer bus was a smoking, filthy old van with a cracked windsreen and surly driver. It was a fair reflection of what we could expect from this hotel. The dimly-lit corridors of rooms with numbers missing from the doors led me to my own personal hell, fully equipped with stained carpets, cracked doors, cigarette-burnt sink, broken hairdryer, dodgy shower, a scratching and squeaking noise in the night that suggested a vermin problem and a stench of smoke that was so bad I actually woke up with a sore throat. Our dinner voucher entitled us to a three course meal of (actually edible) soup followed by boot-leather meat (they claimed veal, I just can't be sure), served just cold enough to be really unpleasant. One of our group's veal included a little stone in the sauce, and my bread roll had metal wire baked right in. The fact that this hotel is classified as four star is an absolute disgrace. I didn't pay to stay here, but you couldn't pay me enough to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake...”
Reviews.Author: Mrs Slow Duck
Reviews.Content: Had I read the previous reviews I would not have stayed at this hotel. Unfortunately I forgot to check TripAdvisor beforehand, and so paid the price! How this can be rated 4* I do not know, especially when compared with others in the Sol Melia group. Admittedly it is close to the airport - however on arriving the free transfer mini-van took a long time to materialise, and once it did, there were too many people for the size of the van and we had to abandon the idea for a taxi instead. Once at the hotel we marvelled at its shabbiness (especially given the smart impression from the website photos), and were amused to see that people had scratched off two of the stars on the name by the lift, leaving Diana **. It was possibly quite generous of them even to leave two! Luckily we arrived late and left early the next morning, so didn´t have time to "enjoy" the hotel. As it was it made for a disappointing and overpriced start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “close to the airport, but that's it!”
Reviews.Author: Lazboh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the night before our return flight home. We wanted to be close to the airport and not have any hassles. We arrive on Sunday night and planned to have dinner and an early evening so we would be rested for our trip home. When we checked in, we were told that they had a lot of people staying there who were bumped from an airline and to figure on a possible 45 minute wait to get the airport shuttle in the morning. Fortunately, we got up early enough so that was not a problem. However, we couldn’t eat in the hotel dining since they were only accepting people who had the airline vouchers for dinner. The other dining room was closed. We were able to eat in one of the small restaurants that seem to be run by someone else. The air conditioning didn’t work properly in our room. The shower spray arm broke when we took a shower on Sunday night and so we couldn’t take a shower Monday morning before we left. The weather was still pretty warm, but the pool looked like a swamp. The only good thing about this hotel was its location.

Reviews.Title: “Bearable for Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: gringo472
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel purely because it was close to the airport and we had a flight from Marrakech due to be landing at 1AM, which was late and we didn't want to be getting a taxi into town at that late hour. The free shuttle bus takes you from outside the airport to the hotel, only takes a few minutes, although waited a while for it to arrive and barely got on because it was so packed, looks like they only have one minibus, so luck of the draw if you get on or not. Check in took ages, and by the time we got to the room it was nearly 3AM. The reception looked ok, but that was as good as it got, one lift wasn't working and the others were dated, the room itself was reasonably large, but the carpets were filthy, especially by the bathroom. Inside the bathroom was clean and bright, which was ok, however there was a small sign on the mirror saying "Madrid Needs Water" and in front of that was a constantly leaking tap, so can't be too desperate for water if they can't be bothered to fix the tap. The shower was extremely powerful, so powerful in fact the shower head fell off the wall, so only way to shower was to hold the shower head in your hand. The door to the bathroom was in a bad state of repair also. The beds were comfortable and clean, although only one pillow and no spares in cupboard. We didn't try the breakfast as we preferred to sleep in later. The rooms struck me as very uniform, everything the same, and lacking any real character, I don't think I would rush back again in a hurry

Reviews.Title: “Don't know what everybody complains about”
Reviews.Author: Johnacoles
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for 3 nights and what other people complain about I cannot see! The shuttle bus was prompt from the airport and the check-in staff were helpful and friendly. The room was nice and clean and the shower was great. Breakfast was continental style buffet and was always fresh. The hotel is being refurbished so there is a little bit of building work going on but nothing to ruin our stay. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “old, run down, 1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: trespequitas
Reviews.Content: What can I say..there is no way this hotel is three or four stars, regardless of how low the standards are for the stars. Old run down, peeled hallways, elevator stopped before completely reaching the floor, nearly no running cold water, therefore showered with scalding hot water. I stayed there for eight hours and was very happy to be out! Don't stay there regardless of how cheap it is it's not worth paying a single buck, they haven't invested a cent in it since it was first built.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you just need a place to sleep for a night”
Reviews.Author: adrianal
Reviews.Content: I had to stay overnight in Madrid in order to take my flight to miami and I chose to stay there. The lobby really needs work done, the hotel is in a project like neighborhood which I wouldn't recomend walking around at night. The beds aren't bad and the room isn't that small. They have a complimentary shuttle which is great even though the driver didn't even try to take my bags. When I got to the hotel, he just dropped them in front of the hotel (not inside or near the door). If you just need a place to sleep and don't want to pay that much, I recomend it. If your looking for something nice or a place where you can walk around, forget it.

Reviews.Title: “"Ramshackle Respite"”
Reviews.Author: Multivalent
Reviews.Content: We spent about 8 hours at Tryp Diana and that was plenty. I had read the mixed reviews and figured it couldn't be that bad for just one night. I should have booked a hostel instead. The hotel can best be described as "tired." On the plus side, the complementary breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “The Tryp was a trip”
Reviews.Author: summurluv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tryp Diana for one night and was happy that I didn't have to stay another. I had read mixed reviews about the hotel prior to booking my stay and thought it couldn't be too bad for just one night. It wasn't great, but most of the negative reviews I read were on target. The hotel is not very well kept. The carpet in the hallway and the rooms were horrible -- VERY worn. I would not walk barefoot. The place could definitely use some sprucing up with paint and air fresheners. Teh bathroom was clean, but the tub was stained. I wished that I had shower shoes. The worse was a blanket in the closet that looked like a dead animal -- complete with what looked like blood on it. There is a free shuttle, but it took forever to come. It is VERY close to the airport and I was happy to be so close. I was there for about 7 hours and was happy to leave. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “starsky and hutch”
Reviews.Author: irishlassDublin
Reviews.Content: remember starsky and hutch? dingy corridors, dingy rooms, dodgy lifts? well, that's near enough to this place. against it, it has stained walls and carpets, threadbare carpets in corridors, lifts that don't arrive or don't open level with the floor, not a great breakfast (coffee is disgusting) and lots of noise. Bar is a rip-off - two glasses of beer and two toasted sandwiches cost E19.50. for it, it has a clean bathroom, is very near the airport with a free shuttle service that did not cause us any problems. if you need to get in late and out early this may be the place for you. Just don't walk barefoot on the carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your ear plugs!!”
Reviews.Author: morgini
Reviews.Content: Bring your earplugs if you stay at this hotel. It is convenient to the airport. The free bus service is great and the driver was courteous as was the front desk. When I opened the door to the room I thought "how nice-wood floors". However, I could hear the child prancing around on the floor above me beginning at 530 am. Also, the walls are paper thin. You don't have to worry about setting alarm as you will hear both rooms on either side of you with their alarm and their entire cellphone conversations and phones ringing. Their is construction going on, but I didn't hear that. Went to one of the cafes in the hotel and waited for 45 minutes for service, decided to leave and order room service-cash only!

Reviews.Title: “No way to come back”
Reviews.Author: bonnalex
Reviews.Content: I just returned from two nights in Tryp Diana. It is not a 4 stars at all, only half of it. I had a leak on the ceiling of the bathroom. The corridor was absolutely old and dirty. Noisy and difficult to find in Madrid Baraja. The shampoo dispenser in the bathroom was empty. Not a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for a nights stop over”
Reviews.Author: fubky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for one night before going to the airport. The room was nice and clean bathroom the same too. It was cheap and the reception staff were helpful when we needed to order a pizza but didnt speak spanish! We checked out quickly and easily at 4am and the shuttle bus was waiting outside and set off as soon as we boarded. Overall a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: rwrw
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its proximity to the airport, a late arrival, and early departure. My problems started with the shuttle from the aiport. The driver seemed far more interested in chatting with women from another bus than taking me to the hotel - despite it being 00:40. I had to repeatedly ask him to do his job - and was unnecessarily delayed by 15 minutes. The hotel apears to have been in need of major renovation for many years. There was a loud plumbing noise that never stopped, that prevented me from sleeping. When I mentioend it to the front desk, they seemed to be aware of it, and had the attitude that this was just part of the hotel. The TV didn't work properly. I strongly advise that you avoid this hotel. It is among the worst I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “One of Worst... to be avoided”
Reviews.Author: Aval
Reviews.Content: The 4-star rating for this place is a mystery on all fronts. We arrived just before midnight, tired after a delayed flight to be left waiting to check-in in the shabby reception for 40 minutes by four disinterested and technologically-challenged staff; plenty of time for us to notice the yellowing ceiling held together by rusty staples, along with that characteristic cocktail smell of stale tobacco and air freshener. Once past that hurdle, the creaking lift deposited us in a gloomy corridor with a carpet so worn the original pattern was a mystery. The room was spacious, but the monastic twin beds were as hard and narrow as two wooden planks. The décor and plumbing was vintage 70's. including the all-night sound effects of drainage from the upper floors. Even the TV was locked in the timewarp on permanent full volume. So our 6 am departure was more than usually welcome ...well it would have been if it hadn't taken a near revolt by fellow passengers desperate about their check-in times to get the hotel bus driver to move before 6.30, and the stunt driver impression that followed. Rarely have I been so pleased to leave a hotel, never to return.

Reviews.Title: “A nice short stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellerOmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night, and had no complaint. The staff was friendly, the shuttle from airport came promptly. The next morning we had to be at the airport at a peak time, and the hotel arranged additional buses to take the guests to the terminals. The room and the bathroom were clean and pleasant. The Hotel is in a residential quarter, there are no restaurants or other facilities in the neighbourhood, but in the hotel itself there are bars, restaurants, etc. Recommended for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “FAR from everything”
Reviews.Author: mzip
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights at this hotel near the airport, because we had an early flight and liked to stayed in madrid the last 4 days of our trip. This hotel is very near the airport but very very far away from any point of interest in madrid. We had a car rented so for us it was no big deal going to and from the city, but one night we payed a taxi and it was like 19 euros wich is very expensive. there is a new line of metro near by but like for a 15 or 20 min walk, or you can ride the bus wich has a station near by. but I think that for the price of this hotel if you do not need to be near the airport look for other hotels in madrids gran via or paseo del prado. or streets near all the interesting stuff. About the hotel its kind of old, people at front desk not overly friendly, it has a bar downstairs, a car rental and a travel agency and restaurant, I didnt visit any of them so no comment. About the rooms ok a bit worn, clean yes no ammenities except for a bar of soap and a shampoo, big towels. It has a safety box on the room but you have to pay 1 euro for every time you open it! It has a parking lot for hotel guests wich is 17 euro per day .

Reviews.Title: “Only for desparate travelers”
Reviews.Author: HG30
Reviews.Content: We had to return to the US quickly and had limited choices in Madrid airport hotels - only stay here if you're desparate. The hotel's main business appears to be from the airlines cancelling flights. The shuttle service is limited and you could end up waiting a long time during peak hours. I had to take a taxi to the airport after waiting 45 minutes for a shuttle. Carpets were thread bare and the bathroom was not clean. Linens are worn and dirty looking.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: uskuhlmans
Reviews.Content: This was indeed a trip but one that need not be repeated. First, the hotel is near the airport but little else. Restaurants, Metro stops, pretty much everything, was not there. The room itself was adequate but it was quite warm and when we tried to turn on the air conditioning, nothing happened. An inquiry at the front desk revealed that air conditioning was for summer and heat was for winter but the present time was neither so the system was off. We were invited to open the windows, which we did, letting in some cooler air and a lot of noise. The came dinner. As we had an early flight we went to the cafe (the restaurant opened only at 20.30) and were served by a team recently graduated from the Larry, Moe and Curly Restaurant Academy. The item we wanted from the menu (an omlette) was "unavailable" but then they decided they could make it. It turned out ok but the price was three times that indicated in the menu. There was no explanation offered. Finally we asked about the shuttle to the airport and were told that it operated every 35 minutes but on no schedule--an interesting and somewhat ambiguous proposition. In the end, it was inexpensive and will provide many anecdotes for conversation, but for any extended period--like over 12 hours--choose another.

Reviews.Title: “For busines travelers and one night visitors”
Reviews.Author: zelestina
Reviews.Content: We staded for one night at Tryp Diana in April 2006. The order was made throught solmelia.com. It's very comfortable for those, who need several hours to sleep between flights. We came at night to Madrid and had to fligh away to Malaga the very next morning. There was a shatlle to pick us up (included in price). And in the morning it took us to the airport. The room was clean and nice. Nothing extrordinary, but on the other hand we weren't looking for this. Just to spend couple of hours in beds, which were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only reasons for staying in this property are its proximity to the airport (about 10 minutes away), the free shuttle to the airport and the early morning (6:30 a.m.) breakfast buffet. And the water was hot. However, if you can find the same amenities elsewhere, do it. (I think we stayed in the same room shown in the previous posting.) Judging from the condition of the place, the owners haven't spent a dime on this place in years. And they have even stopped watering the plants on the balconies. That tells you a lot about how well this place is maintained.

Reviews.Title: “We left after 1 hour. Really bad.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the most shabby hotel I have ever had the displeasure of staying at. After one hour, we checked out. There was mold growing on the walls in our room, and the air was really bad. The carpets throughout the hotel are very worn (threadbaren), and the plaster is falling off the walls in the hallways. We had requested a nonsmoking room with a queen or king bed; however, the nonsmoking rooms only have two tiny (smaller than twin) beds. We told the clerks at the front desk that the room was not inhabitable and that we were checking out. Their response was, "How would you like to pay for the room? Cash or credit card?" We got out of there after paying half price. Terrible. Don't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: RanyDanny
Reviews.Content: I spend one night here while on transit from Madrid to Barcelona. The hotel is just 3 minutes from the airport and has a convenient shuttle. Rooms are very clean and the hotel in general is very nice. The only problem is that the rooms are not very well isolated and you can hear a lot of what's happening with your neighbors. Other than that, very good value for your money. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay at Tryp Diana”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I see by the other reviews that some thought this hotel was a bit shabby. I gather that these folks must be used to paying $200 per night for a hotel. We found it to be quite nice and very convenient, other than the fact that it is not close to a Metro station. However, the hotel shuttle will take you to the airport Metro terminal and pick you up. The neighborhood is very peaceful and delightful, even though it is just off the M40 beltway. We walked to a local sidewalk eatery for a whole barbecued chicken and glass of wine for about E12 for the two of us. If you don'y want to drive into Madrid, I would recommend staying here and taking the Metro route. The Metro is easy to use (from the airport) and only costs 1 euro. There is also a Metro help office at the airport. If you are driving to the hotel, be sure and get good directions from your rental car people, as it is not easy to find in the maze of access ramps even though it is almost next door to the airport. We will probably stay there the next time we visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, shabby rooms - Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: pj813
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the Tryp Diana for free, as Iberia totally screwed up our flights (as usual). However, I would never pay to stay here, and would not recommend it to anyone. It is rather close to the airport - around 15 minutes. However, the receptionist was rude, impatient, and unhelpful (we asked for a non-smoking room with a double bed - some how they did not have any, although it did NOT look full!). The rooms reeked of smoke, were tiny, and the single beds were narrow and too short. The bathroom was filthy, with a broken shower head and ripped shower curtain, and the toilet let was cracked. Overall disappointment and disgusting.
